Instruction: In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth, about 5 minutes. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
Roll each ball into a thin round on a lightly floured surface, about 8 inches in diameter.
In a cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Cook tortillas one at a time until lightly browned, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.

Preheat an ungreased cast iron griddle over medium-high heat. Place one tortilla on the hot griddle and cook until browned spots appear, approximately 1 minute per side. Move to a plate and cover with a cotton towel to keep warm. Continue with the remaining tortillas, stacking them underneath the towel.
To reheat tortillas, microwave them for 10 seconds.
